title: Core Competencies in the Digital Age: Learning Information Literacy Through Humor

context.prior_knowledge: Basic information retrieval and digital tool utilization skills
context.additional_context: Practitioner-focused training emphasizing workplace applicability, structured around hands-on practice using personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners can assess the credibility of various digital information sources with over 80% accuracy
Learners can solve at least three work-related problems using efficient search strategies during information retrieval
Learners can apply copyright and ethical standards with over 90% compliance when creating digital content
Learners can explain at least two information literacy concepts through learning materials containing humor elements

resources: Case Study Materials with Humorous Elements

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
